remarks: TODO-NM:  I think this old version of ~ uzind3 can be removed. Induction on the upper set of integers that starts at ` B ` .  The first four hypotheses give us the substitution instances we need, and the last two are the basis and the induction step.  (Contributed by NM, 9-Nov-2004.)  (Proof modification is discouraged.) (New usage is discouraged.)
statement:
uzind3OLD.1 $e |- ( x = B -> ( ph <-> ps ) ) $.
uzind3OLD.2 $e |- ( x = y -> ( ph <-> ch ) ) $.
uzind3OLD.3 $e |- ( x = ( y + 1 ) -> ( ph <-> th ) ) $.
uzind3OLD.4 $e |- ( x = A -> ( ph <-> ta ) ) $.
uzind3OLD.5 $e |- ps $.
uzind3OLD.6 $e |- ( ( B e. ZZ /\ y e. { z e. ZZ | B <_ z } ) -> ( ch -> th ) ) $.
uzind3OLD $p |- ( ( B e. ZZ /\ A e. { z e. ZZ | B <_ z } ) -> ta ) $.
$d A x z $.
$d B x y z $.
$d ch x $.
$d ph y $.
$d ps x $.
$d ta x $.
$d th x $.
